perturbation.original_text: Marketing Affiliate shall pay to  Equidata, as compensation for its providing of Services under this agreement, such amounts as outlined and detailed in  Exhibit A attached hereto. Such amounts shall be billed on a bi-monthly basis by Equidata and are due and payable in  full by Marketing Affiliate 30 days from the invoice date. The prices set forth in Exhibit A do not include regulatory  fees, sales tax, excise tax or any other fees or taxes that may be charged by states or local taxing authorities nor does it  include additional fees or surcharges, including specific area Affiliate charges that may be accessed by the Credit  Reporting Agencies (CRA's). Said amounts charged to Equidata will be billed separately to Marketing Affiliate and are  due immediately upon receipt.
perturbation.changed_text: Marketing Affiliate shall pay to Equidata, as compensation for its providing of Services under this agreement, mutually agreed upon amounts. Such amounts shall be billed on a bi-monthly basis by Equidata and are due and payable in full by Marketing Affiliate 30 days from the invoice date. The prices do not include regulatory fees, sales tax, excise tax or any other fees or taxes that may be charged by states or local taxing authorities nor does it include additional fees or surcharges, including specific area Affiliate charges that may be accessed by the Credit Reporting Agencies (CRA's). Said amounts charged to Equidata will be billed separately to Marketing Affiliate and are due immediately upon receipt.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the specific reference to 'Exhibit A attached hereto' where the compensation amounts are detailed, while still mentioning that amounts are due, creates uncertainty. There's now no clear method for determining the correct compensation, which introduces a contradiction. The phrase 'mutually agreed upon amounts' is also vague and subject to interpretation, which introduces ambiguity in how the pricing schedule can be modified and whether or not those changes have to be in writing.

perturbation.original_text:
Marketing Affiliate shall give Equidata written demand of dispute within 10 days of the due date of the invoice. The  demand shall set forth a statement for the nature of the dispute and the amount involved. If Equidata and Marketing  Affiliate can not resolve the dispute on their own within 10 days after Equidata receive said dispute, the parties shall  jointly select an arbitrator.                     Initials: /s/ IP

Source: STEEL VAULT CORP, 10-K, 12/24/2008
perturbation.changed_text: Marketing Affiliate shall give Equidata written demand of dispute within 10 days of the due date of the invoice. The demand shall set forth a statement for the nature of the dispute and the amount involved. If Equidata and Marketing Affiliate cannot resolve the dispute on their own within 10 days after Equidata receives said dispute, the dispute will be escalated to senior management.
perturbation.explanation: The original text outlines a clear arbitration process if a dispute cannot be resolved. By removing the arbitrator clause while retaining the dispute resolution process, but replacing it with 'escalated to senior management' creates a contradiction. The contract now provides no clear method for resolving disputes beyond initial negotiation, making any enforcement actions unclear. The arbitrator process is completely removed.

perturbation.original_text: Further guidelines and requirements are provided in Exhibit B and C.
perturbation.changed_text: Further guidelines and requirements are outlined by internal policies.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the specific references to exhibits B and C where the guidelines and requirements are explicitly defined, while still claiming that those guidelines and requirements apply, creates uncertainty and contradiction. There is no reference to access the policies as well as being able to track the policy changes throughout the agreement.
